summary: In 1980, Mount St. Helens in Washington state had a huge volcanic eruption. It started with small explosions and earthquakes, causing a big landslide. This led to a massive blast, sending ash and lava far into the sky. The eruption was very destructive, killing people and animals, and changing the landscape. It was the biggest volcanic eruption in the U.S. in many years. Now, people remember this event and learn from it to stay safe during volcanic activity.
title: 1980 eruption of Mount St. Helens
